s.text: It agrees that Gore's outer robotic-ness masks a warm jocularity, but argues that the warm jocularity itself masks Gore's fundamental emotional coolness.

It agrees that Gore's outer robotic-ness masks a warm jocularity, but argues that the warm jocularity itself masks Gore's fundamental emotional coolness.
See "The Sound of One Hand Talking" for Slate 's take on Franklin and the panel.)
Newsweek interviews John Hope Franklin, chairman of the presidential advisory board on race.
